sentence: At the Federal Reserve, our monetary policy is guided by the dual mandate to promote maximum employment and stable prices.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: From that standpoint, the current picture is plain to see: The labor market is very strong, and inflation is much too high.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: My colleagues and I are acutely aware that high inflation imposes significant hardship, especially on those least able to meet the higher costs of essentials like food, housing, and transportation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: There is an obvious need to move expeditiously to return the stance of monetary policy to a more neutral level, and then to move to more restrictive levels if that is what is required to restore price stability.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: We are committed to restoring price stability while preserving a strong labor market.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: At our meeting that concluded last week, we took several steps in pursuit of these goals: We raised our policy interest rate for the first time since the start of the pandemic and said that we anticipate that ongoing rate increases will be appropriate to reach our objectives.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: These actions, along with the adjustments we have made since last fall, represent a substantial firming in the stance of policy with the intention of restoring price stability.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In my comments today, I will first discuss the economic conditions that warrant these actions and then address the path ahead for monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The Labor Market Is Very Strong and Extremely Tight To begin with employment, in the last few years of the historically long expansion that ended with the arrival of the pandemic, we saw the remarkable benefits of an extended period of strong labor market conditions.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Employment growth powered through the difficult Omicron wave, adding 1.75 million jobs over the past three months.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The unemployment rate has fallen to 3.8 percent, near historical lows, and has reached this level much faster than anticipated by most forecasters (figure 1).
label: LABEL_1

sentence: While disparities in employment remain, job growth has been widespread across racial, ethnic, and demographic groups.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: By many measures, the labor market is extremely tight, significantly tighter than the very strong job market just before the pandemic.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: There are far more job openings going unfilled today than before the pandemic, despite today's unemployment rate being higher.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: It is worth considering why the labor market is so tight, given that the unemployment rate is actually higher than it was before the pandemic.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: One explanation is that the natural rate of unemployment may be temporarily elevated, so wage pressure is greater for any given level of unemployment.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Over time, we might expect these factors to fade, reducing pressure in the job market.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Total demand for labor, measured by total employment plus posted job openings, has substantially recovered and far exceeds the size of the workforce.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Increases in labor force participation often substantially lag declines in unemployment.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Overall, the labor market is strong but showing a clear imbalance of supply and demand.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Our monetary policy tools cannot help with labor supply in the near term, but in a long expansion, the factors holding back supply will likely ease.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In the meantime, we aim to use our tools to moderate demand growth, thereby facilitating continued, sustainable increases in employment and wages.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The Inflation Outlook Has Deteriorated Significantly Turning to price stability, the inflation outlook had deteriorated significantly this year even before Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The rise in inflation has been much greater and more persistent than forecasters generally expected.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: For example, at the time of our June 2021 meeting, every Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) participant and all but one of 35 submissions in the Survey of Professional Forecasters predicted that 2021 inflation would be below 4 percent.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Inflation came in at 5.5 percent.2 For a time, moderate inflation forecasts looked plausibleâ€”the one-month headline and core inflation rates declined steadily from April through September.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: But inflation moved up sharply in the fall, and, just since our December meeting, the median FOMC projection for year-end 2022 jumped from 2.6 percent to 4.3 percent.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In my view, an important part of the explanation is that forecasters widely underestimated the severity and persistence of supply-side frictions, which, when combined with strong demand, especially for durable goods, produced surprisingly high inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The pandemic and the associated shutdown and reopening of the economy caused a serious upheaval in many parts of the economy, snarling supply chains, constraining labor supply, and creating a major boom in demand for goods and a bust in services demand.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The combination of the surge in goods demand with supply chain bottlenecks led to sharply rising goods prices (figure 4).
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Prices soared across the vehicles sector as booming demand was met by a sharp decline in global production during the summer of 2021, owing to shortages of computer chips.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Production remains below pre-pandemic levels, and an expected sharp decline in prices has been repeatedly postponed.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Many forecasters, including FOMC participants, had been expecting inflation to cool in the second half of last year, as the economy started going back to normal after vaccines became widely available.3 Expectations were that the supply-side damage would begin to heal.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Schools would reopenâ€”freeing parents to return to workâ€”and labor supply would begin bouncing back, kinks in supply chains would begin resolving, and consumption would start rotating back to services, all of which could reduce price pressures.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The Policy Response As the magnitude and persistence of the increase in inflation became increasingly clear over the second half of last year, and as the job market recovery accelerated beyond expectations, the FOMC pivoted to progressively less accommodative monetary policy.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: I believe that these policy actions and those to come will help bring inflation down near 2 percent over the next 3 years.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Thus, my main message today is that, as the outlook evolves, we will adjust policy as needed in order to ensure a return to price stability with a strong job market.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: How will fallout from the invasion of Ukraine affect the economy and monetary policy?
label: LABEL_2

sentence: In addition to the direct effects from higher global oil and commodity prices, the invasion and related events are likely to restrain economic activity abroad and further disrupt supply chains, which would create spillovers to the U.S. economy.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: We might look to the historical experience with oil price shocks in the 1970sâ€”not a happy story.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Fortunately, the United States is now much better situated to weather oil price shocks.4 We are now the world's largest producer of oil, and our economy is significantly less oil intensive than in the 1970s.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Today a rise in oil prices has mixed effects on the economy, lowering real household incomes and thus demand, but raising investment in drilling over time and benefiting oil-producing areas more generally.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Second, how likely is it that monetary policy can lower inflation without causing a recession?
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Our goal is to restore price stability while fostering another long expansion and sustaining a strong labor market.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In the FOMC participant projections I just described, the economy achieves a soft landing, with inflation coming down and unemployment holding steady.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Growth slows as the very fast growth from the early stages of reopening fades, the effects of fiscal support wane, and monetary policy accommodation is removed.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: I believe that the historical record provides some grounds for optimism: Soft, or at least soft-ish, landings have been relatively common in U.S. monetary history.5 In three episodesâ€”in 1965, 1984, and 1994â€”the Fed raised the federal funds rate significantly in response to perceived overheating without precipitating a recession (figure 6).6 In other cases, recessions chronologically followed the conclusion of a tightening cycle, but the recessions were not apparently due to excessive tightening of monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: And monetary policy is often said to be a blunt instrument, not capable of surgical precision.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: It is worth noting that today the economy is very strong and is well positioned to handle tighter monetary policy.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Finally, what will it take to restore price stability?
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The ultimate responsibility for price stability rests with the Federal Reserve.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Price stability is essential if we are going to have another sustained period of strong labor market conditions.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: We will take the necessary steps to ensure a return to price stability.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Our monetary policy framework, as embodied in our Statement on Longer-Run Goals and Monetary Policy Strategy, emphasizes that having longer-term inflation expectations anchored at our longer-run objective of 2 percent helps us achieve both our dual-mandate objectives.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In the recent period, short-term inflation expectations have, of course, risen with inflation, but longer-run expectations remain well anchored in their historical ranges (figure 7).
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The added near-term upward pressure from the invasion of Ukraine on inflation from energy, food, and other commodities comes at a time of already too high inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In normal times, when employment and inflation are close to our objectives, monetary policy would look through a brief burst of inflation associated with commodity price shocks.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: However, the risk is rising that an extended period of high inflation could push longer-term expectations uncomfortably higher, which underscores the need for the Committee to move expeditiously as I have described.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: But, to end where I began, inflation is much too high.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: We have the necessary tools, and we will use them to restore price stability.
label: LABEL_1
